Name: 125 Physics Projects for the Evil Genius

ReviewList.Text: In keeping with their theme, the creators of the Evil Genius books have again come up with many different ways to make science FUN!!! My son spends a lot of his free time reading and experimenting or building out of these books and it never feels to him like he's doing schoolwork. If you have other books from this series, then this is a must add for your collection. If you have never delved into this series of books yet, then start now!

So, I bought this for my high-school physics teaching sister and her face was ecstatic. She loved it and has told me that she's tried a few of the projects in her class and her students really responded to them. Good Stuff.
Very good book for getting a great start with physics when you want a hands-on approach to physics this book is very hands-on.
A good book for for science teachers who likes to demonstrate phenomena but does not have enough equipment in the school lab.

This book has many interesting activities in it that can be used to teach and entertain young people. There is enough variety that you shouldn't have any trouble finding some to interest you. I will be mainly using them to teach the 8 to 13 year olds at church by finding a Scriptural principle to highlight with the activity. The kids look forward to this activity every week.

I'm pretty sure the projects done by evil geniuses are...awesome/mind-blowing, not boring and for lack of a better term...lame.  When I think "project", I think, something you build...not something you have to buy.  The title should be, "125 mostly ho hum physics demos".
A reat book to teach project based Physics. Highly recommended for Technology, Science, and Math teachers.
